- Although the VZ2008 looks very similar to an AK47, the only thing it shares in common is the caliber it fires, the 7.62x39mm ( Magazines are NOT interchangeable with AK47 )

- This gun is a Czechoslovakian design from the 1950's that is still in used to this day by the Czech republic as well as Slovakia ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vz._58 )


Technical Information about rifle:

- It is a milled receiver that is lighter and more accurate than the AK47

- Folding wire stock makes this rifle very compact and convenient for storage and transportation

- The gun has a bolt open feature on the last round

- The handguard is made of a wood/polymer mixture and as such, after a few magazines tends to get hot. This can be easily modified by replacing the wood, or adjusting your grip closer to the magazine


Feedback:

-There are many reviews of this rifle, the VZ2008 online, and I can try and provide you with a number of different sources to read through, but a simple search on youtube for VZ2008 or a google search will bring up everyone's experience

- The rifle is AT LEAST 26" in over all length WITH the stock folded or contracted And the barrel is AT LEAST 16" in length
